FOUND IN: Orwellian (pertaining to George Orwell, not directly his pseudonym but related by association)
Trek - A long, arduous walk through rough or difficult terrain.
Gown - A long, flowing outer garment traditionally worn by academics during formal occasions and graduations.
Newgate Prison - A historical old London prison, notorious for housing various criminals throughout history.
Vaganova Academy - The prestigious school for dance and performing arts that trains future dancers who may join the Kirov Ballet or Mariinsky Ballet.
Alcove - A small, tapered recess in a room, often used for display purposes and providing a cozy nook.
Delete - To remove or erase data, text, images from electronic devices or documents.
Graze - To consume small amounts of food periodically throughout the day, especially in an outdoor setting.
